he same challenge to the viability of any composite resource

aries might retain their cache. It it my understanding

han one way to mitigate this problem using HTTP
Headers to indicate the cac=
he-ability of the (composite) resource,
whether the intermediaries must re-=
validate the resource before
presenting the cached version as a response, e=
tc.

Thus, it seems to me, that when it comes to the test of "visibility"
m=
y hypothetical example matches the same behaviors as DELETE, PUT (as
create=
), and POST. In other words, I understand my hypothetical to

late the principles of Fielding's
